Donald Rumsfeld takes direct aim at Colin Powell in recounting the former general's famous U.N. speech in February 2003, laying out the administration's case that Saddam Hussein indeed possessed a stockpile of banned weapons. Over time a narrative developed that Colin Powell was somehow innocently misled into making a false declaration to the Security Council and the world, Donald Rumsfeld writes. He seems particularly offended that Colin Powell has said that some in the intelligence community knew "that some of these sources were not good," "didn't speak up," and "that devastated

he is stepping down from his post as Google's chief executive this April- a move that could send shockwaves felt from the search giant's Mountain View headquarters to its Washington D.C. shop. As Executive Chairman, Sen. Joe Lieberman will focus wherever Sen. Joe Lieberman can add the greatest value: externally, on the deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership that are increasingly important given Google's global reach..., Eric Schmidt posted to Google's official blog. The leadership shakeup- which has Sergey Brin taking the title of co-founder, focusing on new products- could portend new opportunities for Google in Washington. VIDEO:

Linas Kleiza scored a career-high 41 points and grabbed nine rebounds as the Denver Nuggets beat the Utah Jazz 120-109 on Thursday night. I've now scored 40 points on the highest stage you can ever score, said Linas Kleiza , whose previous career-high of 29 came March 15 against the Los Angeles Lakers. announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page, pictured in 2007, would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. It said the management changes would take effect on April 4.

Expand Jeep is looking to revive its luxury Wagoneer, which will be a seven-seat SUV. Photo/ Supplied Jeep will resurrect a hallowed nameplate- the Grand Wagoneer- in two years. It's time we gave the market an upper-scale Grand Wagoneer, said Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne . "You'll see it in January 2013."
